Article Title: Smriti Mandhana wedding postponed: Has Palash Muchhal also deleted Instagram posts?
Article Text:
Smriti Mandhana & Palash Muchhal Add Evil Eye Emoji To Bios Amid Cheating Rumours!

Indian women’s cricket team vice-captain Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal ’s wedding, which was scheduled for November 23, was postponed after unexpected health emergencies in the family.The sequence began when Mandhana’s father, Shriniwas, fell ill on the wedding day and had to be taken to a hospital. A day later, groom-to-be Palash Muchhal was also admitted to a hospital in Sangli, which is Mandhana’s hometown. He was then moved to Mumbai for further treatment and rest.Mandhana’s manager confirmed the postponement and said the families decided to delay the wedding because of these health-related developments. After the announcement, Mandhana removed all wedding-linked posts from her official Instagram account. However, some other photographs with Palash are still available on his social media pages.Both Shriniwas and Palash have now been discharged from the hospital and are recovering. However, the families have not announced a revised date for the ceremony.There has been interest in whether Palash also deleted his wedding content.As of Monday, he has not removed the video of him proposing to Smriti Mandhana. The proposal took place at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, which is the same venue where the Indian women’s team won the Women’s World Cup 2025. Palash uploaded this proposal video on Instagram on November 21.Meanwhile, Team India batter Jemimah Rodrigues, who is a close friend of Mandhana, has withdrawn from the remaining matches of the Women’s Big Bash League (WBBL) to stay with her during this period. The postponement has come only weeks after India’s win in the ICC Women’s ODI World Cup, where Mandhana played a major role in the team’s campaign.
Article Summary: Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal’s wedding was scheduled for November 23. The wedding was postponed after unexpected health emergencies in the family. The postponement has come only weeks after the ICC Women's ODI World Cup. Team India batter Jemimah Rodrigues has withdrawn from the remaining matches of the Women's Big Bash League (WBBL) to stay with her during this period.

Article Title: Karnataka 'breakfast diplomacy': Second meet between Siddaramaiah and DKS draws blank; now, all eyes on Congress high command
Article Text:
'We Are United...Will Go To Delhi If High Command Calls': Siddaramaiah, Shivakumar After Meeting

‘All we want is a peaceful settlement’

‘

Politics is not permanent

’

NEW DELHI: Siddaramaiah and his deputy DK Shivakumar had two breakfasts together within a week, but the deadlock over the Karnataka chief ministerial post does not seem likely to end soon.The second round of the "breakfast diplomacy" at the deputy chief minister's residence drew a blank yet again, after both Siddaramaiah and DKS left the decision to the party high command."When the high command says," Siddaramaiah responded when asked when Shivakumar would become the chief minister."So far, there is no communication from the high command on the timeline for any decision on the matter. If they (high command) call us, we will definitely go and meet them. Tomorrow, I will be meeting AICC General Secretary K C Venugopal at a function where both of us are invited," he added.Both Congress leaders also put up a united front. The chief minister asserted that there are no differences between him and his deputy, adding that they are running the government like “brothers” and will continue to do so in the future as well.Meanwhile, home minister G Parameshwar, another name in the fray for the CM post, acknowledged the stir and called for a “peaceful settlement.”"It's a good thing that our leaders are getting together again for breakfast. All we want is a peaceful settlement of whatever has happened over the month or so. As suggested by the high command, they are meeting for the second time. All the issues are settled. It is just reciprocal, nothing else," Parameshwar said.Additionally, hours after meeting DKS, Siddaramaiah added to the speculation as he was heard saying “politics is not permanent” during an informal conversation with Congress MLA Belur Gopal.Though the context of the conversation — the video of which has gone viral — is unclear, it is being linked to CM change talks in the state."Whatever has to happen, let it happen. Is politics my father's property? Politics is not permanent," Siddaramaiah can be heard telling Gopal Krishna, MLA from Sagara, as they emerged from inside Vidhana Soudha.This comes after the first breakfast between Siddaramaiah and DKS. The outreach comes after the Congress high command nudged both leaders to present a united front ahead of the Belagavi legislature session starting December 8.Earlier, as soon as the Congress government in Karnataka completed its halfway mark on November 20, reports quoting Congress sources suggested that MLAs and MLCs from Shivakumar’s faction had camped in Delhi to push the party high command to make him the next chief minister.DK Shivakumar added to the speculation after he claimed there had indeed been “a confidential understanding on leadership transition among five-six leaders” soon after Congress won a landslide in the 2023 elections.The deputy chief minister made the first reference to the power pact but stopped short of divulging more details. “This is confidential. I don’t want to speak publicly on this,” he said.
Article Summary: Both Siddaramaiah and DKS left the decision to the party high command. The chief minister asserted that there are no differences between him and his deputy. The outreach comes after the Congress high command nudged both leaders to present a united front.

Article Title: Parry wanted to quit crime, so Lawrence had him killed: Kin
Article Text:
ANI photo

CHANDIGARH: A day after Inderpreet Singh, alias Parry, a one-time trusted aide of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, was gunned down on a Chandigarh street, two audio clips, purportedly of Goldy Brar, Lawrence’s rival, were released Tuesday containing a threat to kill Lawrence to avenge the murder, intensifying fears of a gang war.While police are verifying the authenticity of the audios, Parry’s family says he was murdered because he wanted to quit crime. “He was acquitted in eight of the 12 cases against him. He got married on Nov 13 and wanted to start life afresh, leaving the life of crime behind. But the Lawrence gang was not happy with his decision. Parry’s unwillingness to be associated with Lawrence or any other gangster was the main reason behind his murder,” said a relative.“We are affluent. We don’t need his crime money,” added another relative.“Losing her newly-married son has sent Parry’s mother into a state of shock,” said Harneet Singh, Parry’s brother, an ASI with Punjab police. Parry’s father retired as a Punjab police inspector.Talking to TOI over the phone, Parry’s brother said Lawrence was a frequent visitor to their house, and would often stay overnight. Mourning his brother, he said, “My mother would feed Lawrence like a son and he repaid her love by killing Parry.”Recounting his last few hours, Parry’s kin said that on the day of the murder, he left to drop his bride somewhere around 4pm. When he returned, he received a call from one of his friends and left home again. He met some friends at a club in Sector 26 and that is when he received a call from Lawrence, who called him to the nearby timber market to discuss a “personal issue” and said his associates will accompany him, said his family. When he reached the designated spot, he was shot dead, they said.It tallies with what the audio clips say. A voice purportedly of Goldy claims Lawrence called Parry on the phone on Monday, congratulated him on his wedding and said he needed to discuss a personal matter. “He asked Parry to come to a place in Sector 26, saying some of his gang members would meet him there and it would be safe to talk on the phone. When Parry arrived to talk, he was murdered,” he says.The voice on the ‘Goldy’ audio clip then threatens Lawrence, saying, “No one in the world can save you now.”
Article Summary: Inderpreet Singh, alias Parry, a one-time trusted aide of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, was gunned down on a Chandigarh street. Two audio clips, purportedly of Goldy Brar, Lawrence’s rival, were released Tuesday containing a threat to kill Lawrence to avenge the murder. While police are verifying the authenticity of the audios, Parry's family says he was murdered because he wanted to quit crime.

My Final Thoughts: A Trade That Makes Sense for Both

Theand Dallas Mavericks are circling what might be one of the cleaner, more logical trade ideas of the early season: a near-salary-match swap of Buddy Hield for Naji Marshall. With both teams wrestling with roster imbalances and apron complications, this framework has gained traction among analysts - and it may only take a light third-team assist to get across the finish line.This article breaks down why the move makes sense, how the trade fits financially, and what each side stands to gain.Golden State Warriors’ backcourt has become overcrowded. The offseason addition of Seth Curry, the upcoming return of De’Anthony Melton, and the emergence of younger rotation guards have pushed Buddy Hield into a diminished role. His shooting remains valuable, but his defensive liabilities and age (32) are out of sync with what Steve Kerr needs around Stephen Curry as he enters his age-37 season.The Warriors are hunting for wing depth, size, and defensive presence - something Naji Marshall brings immediately. Marshall, at 6’7”, plays with an edge that fits their small-ball identity. As Sporting News framed it, this is a chance to flip “regression for progression.”Dallas Mavericks have struggled early due to injuries and uneven spacing around Luka Dončić and Kyrie Irving. Adding Hield’s proven 40 percent career three-point shooting, currently at 35 percent, gives the Mavericks a plug-and-play floor-spacer who thrives off the ball.A reunion between Hield and Luka makes sense: catch-and-shoot gravity is the one thing that Dallas always seems to need more of. While Hield’s defense remains a concern, Dallas isn’t chasing him to guard wings, they want him to stretch the floor and revive an offense that has sputtered at times.The finances are straightforward, which is rare in today’s apron-heavy NBA. Both players make around $9 million, creating a clean match.The only obstacle is the apron. Both teams are close enough to the line that a harmless third-team salary dump could be required—but nothing involving picks or additional rotation players.This is why analysts consider the deal both realistic and low-friction.Early 2025-26 numbers paint a clear contrast between the two players’ current trajectories.• A 6’7” defensive-minded wing who fits switch-heavy schemes• Added toughness in a frontcourt that still relies heavily on Draymond Green• A more balanced roster without inflating payroll• Perimeter defense that helps mask aging legs in the core rotation• A player averaging 1.3 steals per game - something the Warriors badly need• A career 40 percent shooter who improves spacing instantly• A complementary weapon for Luka Dončić when defenses overload• A veteran scorer who can help stabilize inconsistent bench units• A temporary boost while waiting for injured wings to return• A no-risk flier on a player looking for a fresh startNo trade is perfect, and both franchises would accept certain risks.• Marshall’s 25.8 percent from deep is a real concern• Spacing around Curry and Klay Thompson could tighten• Marshall doesn’t solve their backup-center issues• Hield’s defense remains a glaring weakness• At 32, he offers less long-term upside• He could struggle to earn closing minutes in high-stakes gamesYet neither set of risks is deal-breaking - especially in December, when teams still have time to adjust.This rumored swap is not a blockbuster. It won’t dominate headlines like a superstar trade. But the best in-season moves are often the simplest, targeting needs instead of names.Also read: NBA trade rumors: Los Angeles Lakers predicted to chase $186 million Milwaukee Bucks star to form the league’s next superteam The Warriors would be trading fading shooting for live-wire defense. The Mavericks would be trading defensive grit for floor spacing. Both would be addressing immediate problems without sacrificing assets or flexibility. And in an NBA where margins matter, this is exactly the kind of understated deal that can quietly shift a season. If the teams can navigate the apron complications with a small third-team assist, this is a trade that checks every box.

Article Title: Madison Beer turns Chargers’ victory into a birthday celebration for her mom as Justin Herbert powers through injury
Article Text:
Madison Beer and Justin Herbert (via Getty Images)

Justin Herbert’s gritty performance heightens momentum and fuels talk around his relationship with Madison Beer

Madison Beer brought more than star power to Sunday’s Chargers–Raiders matchup; she also got a full family celebration. While Los Angeles cruised to a 31–14 win, Beer transformed one of SoFi Stadium’s suites into an intimate birthday event for her mother, Tracie Beer. Offering a promising update, Herbert told reporters, "I think they are pretty hopeful actually… It's one of those things where you stabilize it.They are hopeful, so that's a good thing." With a primetime matchup against the Eagles on December 8 approaching, his potential return continues to be a major storyline. Off the field, Herbert’s bond with Madison Beer again became a focal point for fans. With Madison’s mother now attending games, many see it as a sign that the relationship is strengthening.The timing couldn’t be more compelling as the Chargers chase a postseason berth and prepare for a potentially decisive Week 18 showdown with the Broncos, a game that may carry major playoff weight. And if Beer is in the building again, Herbert will certainly hope the good luck continues, minus the injuries.Also read: “End of an old chapter”: Justin Herbert’s beau Madison Beer gets emotional unveiling her new era with her new album ‘Locket’

Article Title: Auston Matthews’ captaincy questioned as former Leafs GM hints the team elevated the wrong figure
Article Text:
Former Leafs GM slams current leadership and claims Auston Matthews was the wrong choice for captain (Getty Images)

Former Leafs boss criticizes leadership group and suggests Matthews isn’t the captain Toronto desperately needs





The Toronto Maple Leafs find themselves in a moment of uncomfortable reflection. What began as a bold shift in leadership by handing Auston Matthews the captaincy has now become a topic of pointed criticism, sparked by a former executive who feels the team lost its compass. The question drawing attention across the hockey world is simple. Did the Leafs pick the wrong captain, and are they now paying the price through uninspired play and fragile identity?Former Leafs GM Gord Stellick spoke plainly about the heart of the issue. He believes leadership and talent are not synonymous. He said, "There's nothing wrong if your best player isn't a leader. All I can say is last year, you couldn't be more of a team guy, a classy guy, the way he (John Tavares) handled the transition, and then the leadership meant nothing, it's not even a visible thing. It's almost like an award to wear the C. " His words echo the sentiment of many frustrated fans who now look back at that decision with uneasy hindsight.Stellick did not stop at questioning Auston Matthews as captain. He revealed who he would have chosen. "If you would have asked me a few years ago, I would've picked Morgan Rielly. He kind of strikes me as a captain, but its an important thing being the captain, and the leadership group is important."Rielly has longevity and presence, but like Matthews, has never quite taken command of the locker room in that commanding way a captain must.Tavares remains the quiet constant. A professional who knows when to speak, when to deliver and when to let his play do the talking. Yet the captaincy shift forced him to take a step back in title, even if not in spirit. Stellick suggested the leadership change carried symbolism more than substance, raising the concern that the Leafs valued optics over intrinsic leadership dynamics.Still, accountability now rests on the current leaders. As Stellick put it, "At some point you got to evolve to be the real leaders, and that's where we're going to find out now, a litmus test, about a team that has no business [being] where they are right now, and can this leadership group lead them?" That test is already underway.If Matthews and his leadership group cannot steer this franchise back to identity and resilience, then the Maple Leafs may soon find John Tavares acting as the quiet stabilizing force once more. Captain or not, his presence still commands respect, even without the C sewn onto his jersey.Also Read: Connor Bedard’s fearless statement after Ducks game shows he’s ready to change the NHL narrative
Article Summary: Former Leafs GM Gord Stellick says Auston Matthews is not the captain Toronto desperately needs. Matthews was named captain last season after John Tavares took a step back in title. Rielly has longevity and presence, but has never quite taken command of the locker room in that commanding way a captain must.

Why the Deal Still Feels Unlikely

The Cincinnati Reds may be approaching the offseason with several areas to evaluate, but one need sits clearly above the rest: adding more power to a lineup that struggled to produce consistent thump. A new trade concept from MLB.com’s Anthony Castrovince puts forward a dramatic solution - one that involves making a push for Minnesota Twins star Byron Buxton through a multi-team blockbuster. It’s an idea built around the Reds’ pitching depth and the possibility of acquiring a dynamic, game-changing outfielder without diving into the expensive end of free agency.But the proposal isn’t limited to a simple two-team exchange. Castrovince outlines a three-team structure involving the Reds, Twins, and Houston Astros, each addressing a different roster priority. For Cincinnati, it’s about landing a high-impact bat. For Houston, it’s securing a mid-rotation arm. And for Minnesota, it’s about collecting a group of prospects to support their transition. The concept may be unlikely to materialize, yet it brings together several logical elements that make it worth exploring.Castrovince’s concept revolves around the Reds leveraging their pitching depth, the Astros reinforcing their rotation, and the Twins securing a wave of prospects.Here is how the deal would look based on the proposal:Buxton, who has spent his entire career with Minnesota, is seen as an ideal fit for a Reds club that has been searching for a dynamic bat. As Castrovince wrote, “Buxton would be perfect for a Reds team that could use its pitching depth to address a lineup in need.”One of the major selling points is Buxton’s contract. He is owed roughly $15 million annually for the next three seasons, a number that sits well below what top free-agent hitters will command on the open market. That affordability naturally increases his appeal across the league, though Buxton previously declared himself “a Minnesota Twin for life,” a statement that could complicate any trade discussions.Houston’s inclusion centers on adding right-hander Brady Singer, who is entering his final year of arbitration. The Astros are facing the likely departure of Framber Valdez in free agency, leaving a gap in the middle of their rotation. Singer fits both their competitive timeline and their payroll.Castrovince noted, “Singer, who is entering his final year of arbitration, does not fit a Twins team in transition but does fit an Astros team that needs an affordable mid-rotation arm.” (H/t: Sporting News)Minnesota’s role in the deal is centered on long-term roster building. Article Title: Patriots TE Hunter Henry’s wife Parker found solace in working as a registered nurse even after her husband made millions in the NFL

Hunter Henry’s wife Parker says being an NFL wife isn’t all “glitz and glamour”

Parker Elizabeth Schmidly opened up to Kelly Burch of Business Insider, revealing how she balanced her demanding nursing career while her husband, Hunter Henry, sustained in the NFL spotlight. Her journey traces back to the moment she first met the New England Patriots tight end.Parker first crossed paths with Henry at the University of Arkansas, where he was a year ahead of her. As she neared the end of her nursing degree, Henry was drafted by the San Diego Chargers (now, Los Angeles Chargers) in 2016, laying the groundwork for a long-distance romance.Despite the miles between them, their bond grew stronger, leading to their marriage in 2018, the same year Parker proudly graduated as a nurse. For the next two and a half years, she found deep purpose and fulfillment working as a registered labor and delivery nurse.Henry’s career has been marked by steady value growth. He began in June 2016 with a four-year, $6.38 million deal, including nearly $4 million guaranteed and a hefty signing bonus of $2.38 million.By March 2020, he secured a lucrative one-year franchise tag with the Chargers, worth over $10 million.The following year, he landed a three-year, $37.5 million contract with the Patriots, and in March 2024, his performance earned him a $27 million extension in New England.When Hunter joined New England in 2021, Parker hesitated at the thought of leaving for Boston. But as soon as she set foot in Massachusetts, she was struck by how much the spirit of Arkansas resonated, where she and Henry had spent their childhood. The weather felt familiar, and the people proved just as steadfast.When the NFL WAG moved to Massachusetts and discovered she was expecting her son, she hung up her nurse’s scrubs. Her sense of purpose flourished from caring for patients to nurturing her growing family, now soon to include three children. Every now and then, she teases that she might just become a school nurse to keep up with her kids.Parker never misses a home game with her kids, but away games turn into a puzzle. “We can’t travel or even stay with the team, so I need to figure out our flights and accommodations,” she told Burch. No matter how late the night, the team always flies straight home, which means Hunter often walks through the door before Parker and the kids do.Parker hits the road for away games whenever Hunter plays in a city where family or friends await. Otherwise, she and her son turn every away match into a cozy ritual at home. Since he naps from 1 to 3 PM each day, they strike a deal: if the game starts early, he gets to catch the second half after his nap.Parker laughs at the fascination with NFL wives and girlfriends, seeing herself and others as regular people simply “trying to wake up and get through the week.” The “glitz and glam” of being an NFL WAG quickly fades away when “you’re handling the mental load of running a home, getting the kids to school, and packing lunches.”During football season, the tight end is entirely in the dark about the daily happenings at home. With no family nearby, Parker depends on hired help to keep things running smoothly in the house. She even uses a Skylight Calendar, allowing the tight end to catch a glimpse of his son at preschool on special occasions.Now that Parker’s son is older, he eagerly tracks Hunter’s schedule, wanting to know where Daddy is traveling, when he’ll return, and the timing of every game. The calendar helps him bridge the distance and feel his father’s presence even when the tight end is away.

The men’s World Cup will expand to 48 teams starting in 2026, making it the largest version in history. He oversaw the awarding of the 2030 World Cup to Spain, Portugal and Morocco, and supported Saudi Arabia’s successful bid for 2034. He has also backed new global competitions, broader development projects and long-term plans aimed at pushing football into new geographic and commercial territory.Heading through 2025, Infantino continues to operate in a space where sport, finance and international visibility overlap. Taylor Swift entered the Kansas City Chiefs week with a surge of momentum that has nothing to do with football. The timing could not be louder. Kansas City plays at home, Travis Kelce is back in the spotlight, and Taylor Swift arrives at the weekend with a chart win that shifts the entire storyline again.Taylor Swift has been promoting her latest album “The Life of a Showgirl” since Oct. 3. She has spoken publicly about making it during the tour, balancing three-show runs with midweek flights to Sweden, and recording while exhausted but creatively locked in. Her effort has translated into another wave of record breaking numbers that hit just hours before the Chiefs and Texans step on the field.Taylor Swift received confirmation on Dec. 1 that “The Fate of Ophelia” has matched “Anti-Hero” as her longest-running Billboard Hot 100 No. 1. It has now spent eight total weeks at the top of the chart. The reporting from Billboard states that this run is even more significant because holiday music has flooded the top ten. Mariah Carey , Wham, Brenda Lee and Bobby Helms all climbed into the highest positions this week, which normally pushes non-holiday songs down.Taylor Swift held her spot anyway.Billboard credits “The Fate of Ophelia” with 21.6 million streams, 62.1 million radio impressions and 25,000 copies sold in the United States between Nov. 21 and Nov. 27. The track also kept its lead on Streaming Songs, returned to No. 1 on Digital Song Sales and rose to No. 2 on Radio Songs. A Chainsmokers remix released on Nov. 25 reportedly lifted her late November numbers.She told Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce, “I wanted melodies that were so infectious that you were almost angry at it and lyrics that are just as vivid, but crisp and focused and completely intentional.”She also spoke about the toll of creating while touring. “I would be playing three shows in a row, I’d have three days off. Article Title: WNBA’s bold new pay plan offers huge salaries but comes with a risky catch for players
Article Text:
WNBA's recent decision sparked controversy (Image via Getty Images)

WNBA’s new season schedule could create problems with the NCAA and for new players

WNBA plans big salary increases, with top players set to earn $1 million

After more than a year of contentious back-and-forth over CBA negotiations, the WNBA has put a daring new offer on the table. This might drastically restructure player pay and perhaps vault top stars into the seven-figure salary tier.As part of a new collective bargaining agreement, the WNBA has suggested a seven-figure base maximum compensation, but there is a price. According to multiple league sources who spoke with Front Office Sports, the league has eliminated team housing from proposals made to the Women's National Basketball Players Association.The proposal, which was made public by WBB insider Khristina Williams on X, is the league's most aggressive attempt to resolve long-standing complaints over revenue sharing and compensation. The pressure is officially on now that the CBA clock has been extended until January.Williams wrote on X that a source involved with negotiations informed her that the league is proposing a revised compensation system directly related to franchise and league revenue growth. This adjustment has the potential to significantly increase future profits.The official report read:“The WNBA has proposed cutting team housing in addition to an earlier start date, according to multiple sources. The start date for training camp could be as early as mid-March, sources indicated, which would come with serious implications…”Since 2016, teams have been obligated to give players housing during the season.The league has also proposed lengthening the season, including an earlier start date that is expected to collide with the NCAA tournament and maybe other leagues such as Project B.The start date for training camp might be as early as mid-March, sources revealed. The current 44-game regular season runs from mid-May until early September. The 2025 WNBA Finals finished October 10.Meanwhile, the WNBA has declined to respond. Multiple sources have viewed the WNBA’s latest plan as directly interfering with the timing of the NCAA tournament and would see rookies arriving weeks into the season.Salary rises were the focal point of the league's most recent proposal, which was revealed on Monday. A person familiar with the negotiations claims that the league's proposal calls for a maximum base compensation of $1 million, which could rise to $1.2 million due to possible revenue-sharing gains. Additionally, multiple players per squad would be eligible to sign for this supermax base in 2026.It is anticipated that the mean salary will go beyond the mark of $500,000, with less than $225,000 being the lowest salary. The salary cap, which at present stands at $1.5 million for each team, would see an increase up to $5 million. The league’s latest proposal reportedly envisages the salary cap to increase with both league and team revenue without any targets.The new WNBA package is centered on a guaranteed $1 million base salary for max players beginning in 2026. With revenue sharing added, those earnings might approach $1.2 million. The league also wants to lift the average wage to more than $500,000, and increase the team salary cap from $1.5 million to $5 million in the first year.The cap would then increase in accordance with team and league income each year, establishing a clear financial connection between player salary and growth.Also read: Sophie Cunningham unleashes fiery criticism on WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert, calling for respect and real change in the league
Article Summary: The WNBA has put a daring new offer on the table for a new collective bargaining agreement. The league has eliminated team housing from proposals made to the Women's National Basketball Players Association. It has also proposed lengthening the season, including an earlier start date that is expected to collide with the NCAA.

Article Title: Travis Kelce’s mom Donna returns to screens in a charming holiday film while teasing big Google Christmas reveal
Article Text:
Donna Kelce to take role in ‘The Gift Exchange’ (Getty Images)

Donna Kelce’s new acting journey in The Gift Exchange



Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce tried his hand at acting earlier this year, and now Donna Kelce is joining the fun with a holiday project of her own. The proud NFL mom revealed that she is starring in a new Christmas-themed collaboration with Google, and the announcement itself felt like something straight from a holiday film. On December 1, she posted a snowy and charming movie-style poster on Instagram, presenting herself in the heart of a festive town square while a couple exchanges gifts in front of her. Donna stood with a gentle smile, wearing a cozy sweater and clasping her hands in the warm glow of a classic seasonal moment.Her caption added a touch of anticipation. “#Google_Partner #sponsored Gather the family for a new holiday (and @google) classic. Trailer kicking off soon.” It was short, spirited and enough to send fans into a cheerful buzz. The poster design also played into that spirit. With rich red and green lettering, the film title The Gift Exchange, and the Google tie-in slogan “Searching for something unforgettable? Just ask Google. ” it delivered the full holiday sentiment many viewers adore.Donna takes on the role of Carole Hall in this project. She appears alongside WWE star Nikki Garcia as Holly Hall and Chicago Fire actor Taylor Kinney as Aiden Winter.In the poster, her character looks like the wise and kind observer, pleased to see a love story unfold before her. While Donna revealed no further specifics about the production, her post did suggest it might be a holiday short film or sponsored cinematic campaign. Either way, fans embraced it, calling for more Donna screen time.This moment marks more than entertainment. It reflects a personal chapter for Donna Kelce. Just recently, she shared on the Not Gonna Lie podcast that she once dreamed of aviation. “I did learn how to be a pilot before I had children,” said Donna on the Not Gonna Lie podcast. “So, I actually went up and flew a plane. I did [enjoy it], but you want to have children, and it was really expensive, so I had to stop.” She chose family life, earned an MBA from Baldwin Wallace University, completed studies at Ohio University, then worked three decades in banking as the “major breadwinner in the family. ”Her appearance in The Gift Exchange is not her first on camera. She also showed up in Hallmark productions like Holiday Touchdown: A Chiefs Love Story and Christmas on Call, and called her earlier acting experience “so awesome.” Donna is also preparing for the new season of The Traitors, which adds to her growing media presence. Article Title: Bill Gates wants you to read these 5 books as 2025 comes to end, almost
Article Text:
The five books that Bill Gates wants you to read





Remarkably Bright Creatures by Shelby Van Pelt

Clearing the Air by Hannah Ritchie

Bill Gates No Longer among Top 10 Billionaires: The Real Reason

Who Knew by Barry Diller

When Everyone Knows That Everyone Knows by Steven Pinker

Abundance by Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson





Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has revealed his annual holiday reading list as the 2025 comes to a close. Gates has recommended five books and he believes that all these titles spark curiosity and reflection during the quieter days of the winter season. “Each of these books pulls back the curtain on how something important really works: how people find purpose later in life, how we should think about climate change, how creative industries evolve, how humans communicate,” wrote Gates.In the blog post, Gates has also explained that holidays are the perfect tome to slow down and also catch up on reading. “There’s something about the quieter days around the holidays that makes it easier to sit down with a good book,” he wrote. His list on 2025 book recommendations reflects on his fascination with how the world works and how you can start a great conversation.The book belongs to the fiction genre and its a story of an aging janitor and a wise octopus captive hime with its empathy and storytelling. “Van Pelt's story made me think about the challenge of filling the days after you stop working—and what communities can do to help older people find purpose,” said Gates.The books explains about the climate challenges. The book structures 50 big questions on climate change, nuclear power and renewables. “ I’ve followed Hannah’s work at Our World in Data for years, and her new book is one of the clearest explanations of the climate challenge I’ve read. She’s realistic about the risks but grounded in data that shows real progress,” said Gates.It is a memoir which recounts the Diller’s extraordinary career in Hollywood, media, and technology, blending personal anecdotes with reflections on power, risk-taking, and the evolution of entertainment and digital industries. “He’s spent his life betting on ideas before they were obvious, and the industries he’s transformed show how much those bets can pay off,” said Gates.The book explains about the mysteries of human behaviour and how people communicate. “Although the topic itself is pretty complicated, the book is readable and practical, and it made me see everyday social interactions in a new light,” added Gate.The books offers a glimpse of at why America seems to struggle to build things and what it will take to fix that. The book argues that progress depends not just on good ideas but on the systems that help ideas spread.
Article Summary: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has revealed his annual holiday reading list as the 2025 comes to a close. Gates has recommended five books and he believes that all these titles spark curiosity and reflection during the quieter days of the winter season. “Each of these books pulls back the curtain on how something important really works, how we should think about climate change, how creative industries evolve, how humans communicate,” wrote Gates.

NEW DELHI: MS Dhoni 's impact at Chennai Super Kings has long been hailed for its calmness, loyalty and unmatched leadership — but former CSK star Mike Hussey has now lifted the curtain on a lesser-known side of the franchise: the off-field bonding culture built around Dhoni's open-door hospitality.In a fascinating revelation on The Overlap Cricket podcast, Hussey said Dhoni's room effectively became CSK's unofficial team lounge during every IPL season. Players drifted in and out at all hours, discussing cricket, bantering, sharing meals — and for some, unwinding with shisha.“Dhoni is just the most amazing guy. His room is available open 24 hours a day. Anyone can go up there and just sit. He has got his lounge room, players just sit around, they start talking cricket, some of them like the shisha, you know, the flavoured tobacco stuff. That is their way of socialising. Credit to Dhoni, he opens his room up — lots of players go up, they bring food up, it is fantastic,” Hussey said, offering a glimpse into the camaraderie that defined CSK's IPL dynasty.The anecdote echoes former CSK batter George Bailey 's earlier revelation that Dhoni often hosted relaxed hookah sessions to help younger players settle into the team.Bailey had said Dhoni's informal approach broke down hierarchy and helped create a sense of belonging — a trademark CSK value over the years.Hussey also shared a surprising detail about Dhoni's preparation habits: despite being one of the game's greatest wicketkeepers, he almost never practised the skill in training.“I think the only time I've seen him catch a ball was when we wanted to knock in a new pair of gloves. I've never seen him practise his keeping ever. But he bats a long, long time — he hits thousands and thousands of balls,” Hussey revealed.With Dhoni set to return for IPL 2026 after being retained by the five-time champions, stories like these underline why CSK players past and present continue to call the franchise a “family” — one built on trust, comfort and a legend whose door was literally always open.

Kyle Shanahan stays hopeful as the San Francisco 49ers await progress

The 49ers have confirmed that they won't be starting his 21-day practice window during the Week 14 bye, which means there's only a slim four-week window left in the regular season before the playoffs might begin. If the team qualifies for the postseason, that timeline could be pushed back, allowing for more chances to activate him. Still, the main issue is getting medical clearance, as Aiyuk's rehab is going well but isn't at a competitive level just yet.Even with the challenges, Shanahan is still the biggest supporter of Aiyuk's comeback. While chatting on KNBR, the coach shared with host David Bonilla from 49erswebzone, “Oh, I’m definitely still hopeful. I'm not counting on it, but I'm definitely still hoping that can happen." This statement underscores Shanahan's personal investment in Aiyuk, whom he has praised for his on-field impact and leadership potential, even amid the absences.Shanahan's optimism matches what he and receivers coach Leonard Hankerson said earlier in the offseason, praising Aiyuk's proactive rehab work during training camp. However, the way the coach expressed it, "not counting on it" signals practical strategy.
